textbooks.title: The Engineering Design of Systems: Models and Methods
textbooks.author: Dennis M. Buede and William D. Miller

textbooks.title: Applied Space Systems Engineering
textbooks.author: Larson, Kirkpatrick, Sellers, Thomas and Verma

textbooks.title: Model-based integration and testing of complex high-tech systems
textbooks.author: Jan Tretmans (Editor)

grading.policies: Late submissions must be discussed with the instructor.

policies.late_work: Contact the instructor to discuss late submissions.
policies.academic_integrity: All students must adhere to the Graduate Student Code of Academic Integrity.
policies.accommodations: Students with documented disabilities can receive accommodations through the Office of Disability Services.

additional_info.course_format: This course combines recorded lectures, readings, case studies, discussion questions, and exercises.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer skills, navigating Canvas, live web conferencing using Zoom, and specific software.
additional_info.support_resources: Contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) for course access support.

_metadata.course_description: This course provides an understanding of systems integration, approaches to architect, design, implement, verify, and validate integrated systems.
learning_outcomes: Understand the relationship between system architecture and system integration.
Understand the relationship between system requirements and verification testing.
Understand the relationship between stakeholder needs and system validation.
Develop plans for systematically integrating a complex system.
Represent needs of integration, verification and validation needs early in the system lifecycle.
Design effective verification and validation systems.
Design verification tests to ensure that system specifications are met.
Design validation tests to demonstrate that customer and stakeholder needs are fully met.
Utilize a wide range of testing methods and tools.
